about.header: Here you can search for the Museum of Natural history‚Äôs collections
about.header2: The collections you can search for are:

collectionLabel.smtpObj: Swedish Malaise Trap Project (SMTP) Collection Objects
collectionLabel.smtpList: Swedish Malaise Trap Project (SMTP) Species Lists

SMTP_INV.name: Swedish Malaise Trap Project (SMTP) Collection Objects

contact.departmentBio: Department of Biodiversity Informatics och Genetic of Swedish Museum of Natural History
contact.text: Feel free to contact us with questions, tips and comments. We always try to help as best we can.

help.advanceSearchSubtitle: With advance seach you can search using
help.autocompleteDesc: Type at least 3 letters to see suggestions
help.basicSearchText: Use the ‚ÄúFull-text search‚Äù field to search through every available field, such as scientific names (taxon), collection names, locality information, and related content.
help.checkboxSearchText: You can use the checkboxes to filter results by the following criteria:
help.checkboxHasImages: Has images ‚Äì Only show items that include images.
help.checkboxHaveCoordinates: Have coordinates ‚Äì Only include results with coordinates.
help.checkboxIsType: Is type status ‚Äì Filter for specimens marked as type status.
help.checkboxInSweden: In Sweden ‚Äì Show only items collected within Sweden.
help.checkboxNordic: Nordic countries ‚Äì Include items collected in any of the Nordic countries (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Iceland).
help.collectionNameSearchText: The Collection Name field supports multiple selections and uses autocomplete to help you find matching values quickly.
help.collectionNameSearchHelp1: Start typing at least 3 letters to see a list of matching collections.
help.collectionNameSearchHelp2: You can select multiple collection names to include in your search.
help.collectionNameSearchHelp3: The search will return records that match any of the selected collections.
help.collectedDateSearchText: You can filter search by collected date using either:
help.collectedDateRangeSearch: Click the calendar icon to select a start date and an end date for your search.
help.collectedYearRangeSearch: Switch to 'Filter by Collecting Year' mode, then use the calendar to select a start year and an end year.
help.contains: Contains ‚Äì Finds records that contain the specified phrase anywhere in the fields.
help.containsExample: Searching for aves v√§sterg√∂tland will return records that contain both 'aves' and 'v√§sterg√∂tland' in either the scientific name or the locality fields.
help.exact: Exact ‚Äì Finds records that match the exact phrase.
help.exactExampleSecifitcName: Searching for 'Pica pica' will return records where the scientific name is exactly Pica pica.
help.exactExampleLocality: Searching for 'Bor√•s Djurpark' will return records where the locality is exactly Bor√•s Djurpark.
help.fullTextSearchOptions: There are three supported search operators
help.howToSearchText: Use the search tool to explore the museum‚Äôs online collections. You can search for a wide variety of specimens, including fossils, plants, animals, minerals, and more.
help.predefinedFilters: Predefined filters, such as: catalog number, locality, taxon name, common name etc...
help.predefinedFiltersText: You can narrow your search by specifying filters for specific fields.
help.returnMatchingTerms: will return all specimens matching both terms.
help.scientificNameSearchText: You can search scientific names using three operators
help.scienticNameSearchExact: Exact ‚Äì Matches the exact scientific name.
help.scienticNameSearchContains: Contains ‚Äì Finds names that contain the search term(s) anywhere.
help.scienticNameSearchStartWith: Starts with ‚Äì Finds names that begin with the search term.
help.startWith: Starts with ‚Äì Finds records where the field begins with the specified phrase.
help.startWithExample: Searching for Milvus will return records where scientific name starts with 'Milvus milvus milvus' or 'Milvus migrans'
help.synonymsSearchDesc: Search records where a field begins with the specified text.
help.text: If you're unsure how to search or can't find what you're looking for, contact us:

labels.collectingDate: Date collected [Date range: start - end or start year - end year]

results.num_results: Total 0 records | Total {n} record | Total {n} records

startPage.text1: The Swedish Museum of Natural History hosts more than 11 million specimens, collected over a period of more than 300 years. Here, you can search for all items that are currently registered in the museum‚Äôs collection management systems.
startPage.text2: Over 4 million objects are already registered, including around 170,000 type specimens and approximately 130,000 objects with photographs, representing biodiversity from across the world.
startPage.text3: The digitalization of our collections is an ongoing process, and new records are added and updated every day.
startPage.text4: Please note that some information may be incomplete or inconsistent. These variations reflect historical data entry practice, many records were created decades or even centuries ago, long before modern digital standards existed. The collection interface presents the information as it was originally recorded, ensuring transparency and respect for the historical documentation.

search.searchAll: Search collections (species, genus, family, collectors, location, etc.)
